meanings.definition: To utter a loud, mournful cry or howl.
meanings.sent1: The wolf was behowling in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The dog started behowling when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly figure seemed to be behowling for its lost soul.
meanings.sent4: The wind was behowling through the trees like a sorrowful spirit.
meanings.sent5: The behowling of the wind made the night feel eerie and unsettling.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, mournful sound.
meanings.sent1: The old house was behowling with the sound of the wind.
meanings.sent2: The wounded animal was behowling in pain.
meanings.sent3: The behowling of the wind outside made the children shiver.
meanings.sent4: The behowling of the storm echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The behowling of the wind created a haunting atmosphere in the abandoned town.

meanings.definition: To cry out loudly and mournfully.
meanings.sent1: The lost child was behowling for help in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The grieving mother behowled in anguish at the loss of her child.
meanings.sent3: The behowling of the wind seemed to mimic the cries of the lost souls.
meanings.sent4: The behowling of the sirens filled the air with a sense of urgency.
meanings.sent5: The behowling of the wolves in the distance sent a chill down his spine.
